personally.

Happy to announce that I'll be bringing a few of my colleagues this year to Soltau, and for @NordicTweets  to be the first sponsor listed on the event's website. This community is special, and I am extremely excited to be meeting you in person again! https://t.co/2k8ylRN2ZL

Now every Lambda function comes with its own HTTP endpoint.
No more need to configure an API Gateway! https://t.co/4XR1TbIgnT

You might not have @NordicTweets on your radar if you are interested in working on #cloud-based projects because we don't have a track record in building world class cloud solutions ... yet.
But have a look at this: 

(source: https://t.co/2aUHMQ8PnR) https://t.co/igGySkzYTS

#CellularIoT revenue last year was ~3%, it's cute. But this is going to grow rapidly; after all Nordic invested USD$100M+ into this new product (the #nRF9160), and launched it in 2018. It takes a while for hardware products to reach production maturity, but it's starting now.

So, if you are looking to join a young and developing segment, within a very well established and technically excellent organization, which will give you both access to fantastic resources and a lot of opportunities to grow learn, have a look at our jobs: https://t.co/PQzXx9qu5D

We have quite a few cloud, frontend, and mobile roles which you might not associate with a chip manufacturer. My more experienced colleagues especially enjoy the deep focus on solving those challenging technical problems, which we can't google, because we see them first.
I'm happy to answer you questions, my DMs are always open.
Note that contrary to what is mentioned in the blog post, support is not yet available in CloudFormation or CDK: https://t.co/vaMxyokL0y
@kmelve TBH this will immediately make me click unsubscribe for all future marketing emails. I don't need a reminder to a service that I just signed up to. @sanity_io

Shout out to @aebaR who has been improving the React code @DistributeAid which I don't have the patience to deal with. üôèüèª

https://t.co/1G2bnoTHrK
@kmelve @sanity_io But why can't you put this on the page after the (first) login / once signup is completed? Why sent it in an email?

@kmelve @sanity_io Yeah, I'm not saying this is true for anyone, but me. 

One solution could be a checkbox during signing: "email me getting started instructions".

@kmelve @sanity_io Yeah, there is no other obvious solution then releasing it and seeing how it performs.

If I were interested in an email, I'd love to get a hello world walkthrough with pre-filled API keys and TypeScriptsample, so I can start building withouth needing to dig through the docs.
@kmelve @sanity_io TS is amazing for beginners, because auto complete in your IDE.

@kotzendekrabbe You need a significant amount (good amount is more than 20%) income from other contracts and need to maintain marketing efforts to promote your services. It's still pretty problematic in Germany for solo consultants. @VGSDeV offers great resources and support.

"Ukraine needs security guarantees, it needs to be able to defend itself or it will not be a sovereign country anymore.

I'd also recommend talking to a consultant from https://t.co/kaS1juWvpx ... Ours is based in Darmstadt, so you might find one closer to you.

Yes, with all the work we *could* solve through software implementation @DistributeAid, we need to find *highly flexible and usable* tools that allow reports to be maintained without code. @kotzendekrabbe @VGSDeV If you work as a contractor (aka Freiberufler) you are generally not required to pay social security. Is that what you mean with "main freelance contractor"?

@_francied In general we are doing quite well, we hired around 200 people last year, which is roughly +20%. And most are engineers. I have some special challenges, which I think boil down to the missing track record my employer has for cloud solutions.

@_francied And most seniors can find work at established cloud solution providers which gives them a higher chance of success and basically a guaranteed career path, because they already have huge revenue in cloud services. My employer hasn't yet reported any revenue from cloud businesses.

I'm working with a codebase where #GraphQL queries are shared and reused between components. And some even include "all fields from sub-entity" fragments. Isn't this an anti-pattern? Shouldn't every component request exactly the fields it needs?
@stanislav But should merging of requests be solved by the GraphQL client?
